body_html:
Hi,

I posted a reply at: https://groups.google.com/a/tensorflow.org/forum/?utm_medium=email&utm_source=footer#!msg/discuss/FTcjjGhZOkA/BHH1j9mWAgAJ

There is a little more detail in this message. You need to use the cuDNN 5.0 that works with CUDA 8.0, that is certain. I am not sure if you need to run Ubuntu 16.04 for the GTX1080 driver, but keep that in mind if you have trouble after the cuDNN update.

Here is my execution of your test script:
body_text:
Hi,
I posted a reply at: https://groups.google.com/a/tensorflow.org/forum/?utm_medium=email&utm_source=footer#!msg/discuss/FTcjjGhZOkA/BHH1j9mWAgAJ
There is a little more detail in this message.  You need to use the cuDNN 5.0 that works with CUDA 8.0, that is certain.  I am not sure if you need to run Ubuntu 16.04 for the GTX1080 driver, but keep that in mind if you have trouble after the cuDNN update.
Here is my execution of your test script:
body:
Hi,

I posted a reply at: https://groups.google.com/a/tensorflow.org/forum/?utm_medium=email&utm_source=footer#!msg/discuss/FTcjjGhZOkA/BHH1j9mWAgAJ

There is a little more detail in this message.  You need to use the cuDNN 5.0 that works with CUDA 8.0, that is certain.  I am not sure if you need to run Ubuntu 16.04 for the GTX1080 driver, but keep that in mind if you have trouble after the cuDNN update.

Here is my execution of your test script:

![screenshot 2016-08-22 17 11 10](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/18412448/17873198/16b0f01a-6892-11e6-975c-097f6fee4890.png)
